Title: Fungoid Cave-Shaman
Legend: Gibbering priests of Gorkamorka and speakers of the will of the Bad Moon, Fungoid Cave-Shamans are as much mushroom as magic-wielder. Their cunning and spellcraft are infamous, and their Spore Squigs wreathe them in a fug of choking fungal foulness.
Intro: A Fungoid Cave-Shaman is armed with a Moon-sickle.

Rules.Name: Battalions
Rules.Rule: BATTALIONS: This warscroll can be used in the following warscroll battalions: • Bosses of the Skrap

Rules.Name: Wizard
Rules.Rule: WIZARD: This unit can attempt to cast 1 spell in your hero phase and attempt to unbind 1 spell in the enemy hero phase.

Rules.Name: Companion
Rules.Rule: COMPANION: This unit is accompanied by Spore Squig armed with Vicious Teeth.

Rules.Name: Mouthpiece Of Mork
Rules.Fluff: The visionary Fungoid Cave-Shamans have a knack for coming up with kunnin’ plans.
Rules.Rule: Mouthpiece of Mork: If this unit is on the battlefield at the start of your hero phase, roll a dice. On a 4+, you receive 1 extra command point.

Rules.Name: Deffcap Mushroom
Rules.Fluff: These mushrooms enhance the eater’s magical capabilities.
Rules.Rule: If this unit is in a Gloomspite Gitz army, once per battle in your hero phase, you can say this unit will eat a Deffcap Mushroom. If you do so, this unit can attempt to cast 1 additional spell in that hero phase, and that spell can be any spell from the Lore of the Moonclans.

Rules.Name: Spore Squig
Rules.Fluff: Spore Squigs exude thick green spores that hide their masters from sight.
Rules.Rule: This unit is not visible to enemy units that are more than 12" away.

Rules.Name: Spore Maws
Rules.Fluff: The Cave-Shaman causes the thick spores around him to coalesce into gnashing green mouths.
Rules.Rule: Spore Maws is a spell that has a casting value of 7 and a range of 6". If successfully cast, each enemy unit within range suffers D6 mortal wounds (roll separately for each unit).
